definition: a trough (see trough sense 1a) or open box in a stable designed to hold feed or fodder for livestock
examples: We had our stage props now: a radiating tinfoil star and one of those mangers you see in Nativity scenes and nowhere else.
The first stall was a large square one, shut in behind with a wooden gate; … it had a low rack for hay and a low manger for corn …
